website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind sticking to small print jobs, the Cube 3 is as good as it gets for a compact 3D printer.
pros: The 3D Systems Cube 3 is well-designed and easy to use
The printer builds small objects excellently and is inexpensive for a printer that can print with two materials in the same job
cons: Printing large objects can randomly fail halfway through the process, and the printer needs to cool down after a job before it can print again
The machine uses 3D Systems' expensive proprietary filament cartridges

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter as a birthday gift and she just loves it! She has printed several things already. Very easy to use and set up. It doesn't take up much space. The only down side we see so far is it is not very quiet. So we have to move it to a place where you can't hear it if something takes a long time to print. It really is a great 3D printer.
customer_reviews.author: Marylou Turner

customer_reviews.title: ... the entire spool of filament Other than that it's perfect It's a bit noisy but it's a very nice ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of it's affordability Where I work I have a k-12 only 3d printer by variquest and I wanted one for myself to use at home I'll tell you now dot the use the glue it's just not worth it all you have to do is use Scott's blue painters tape And it works perfectly There is only one prom or if the filament inside the spool breaks you can't use the entire spool of filament Other than that it's perfect It's a bit noisy but it's a very nice size Overall it's a pretty good printer if you know the hacks of a 3d printer
customer_reviews.author: trevor klair

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: If you want to take apart the proprietary filament cartridge twice a day then this is for you. Extremely disappointed ... now I know why it’s discontinued. Filament breaks regularly. Hard to level and gap. Really just a bad product. Look elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer design buy a bulk loading machine
customer_reviews.text: Been fighting with it for 6 mos now, the print quality is great but it only prints with brand new filament, all the filament I have purchased from 3D systems gets hard and brittle after the first use and breaks inside and jams the feeder, I have to then tear the filament feeder apart and throw out filament until I get to useable stuff again, and at $50 a piece that's ridiculous they need to make a bypass so you can run bulk, terrible printer design driven by greed

customer_reviews.title: the extrudes never heats up basically if you want the worst possible experience this is it
customer_reviews.text: If i could give it less stars i would. The print plate wont level, the extrudes never heats up basically if you want the worst possible experience this is it. The usb stick also doesn't show up on the cube. And since it is discontinued you cannot get a refund or support terrible product and worse company
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cogshall

customer_reviews.title: A really good printer
customer_reviews.text: A really good beginner 3d printer. The filament is a very detailed part. I had a little jam, but Cubify supported and I fixed it. It does a really good job printing in 2 different colors. People say that the filament is to expensive. I printed something 3x4x3 and it only took up 2% of the filament!! It does a really good job recognizing if it has any problems. It is a good designed printer and the software is really good. It has a lot of features that other printers do not have. Overall, I would recommend this a #1 printer.
customer_reviews.author: DenonDoyle

customer_reviews.title: The company I purchased this item from was great about helping me with the return and what not ...
customer_reviews.text: The company I purchased this item from was great about helping me with the return and what not but the item it self did not work out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful buy
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer thinking it'd be worry free. Sure the cartridges are $50.00 each but it's like an HP printer, run at a loss, sell high ink cost, good print. Thing is, this isn't worry free or good prints. I only made a half dozen small prints before the head began to stop extruding filament. Calling the manufacturer got me nowhere. Their DIY cartridge fix it help was horribly hard and just killed my last working cartridge. I can accept if this is a DOA issue but not the cartridges both failing. Clearly bad design here. I wish everyone to take a good look at what they want you to do, then ask yourself, is it worth it: [...]
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line: "It's as if they disabled to the unit from working except with the internal print test."
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these because it was on sale. Bottom line it doesn't work: -It was annoying to go through an online signup to get a serial unlock code -It took about 30 minutes to start the first print -To this day it can ONLY print the built in test print "dog tag" -USB flash drive doesn't work -Wifi doesnt connect, despite numerous attempts -Adhoc wifi mode doesnt detect -Direct-USB connect doesn't work. It's as if they disabled to the unit from working except with the internal print test. Also as far as print quality goes it was just okay from the side, but the top surface infill was pretty horrible, even compared to my M3D micro unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Do. Not. Buy. In order to use this printer now that it has been discontinued, you need to modify the firmware and 3D print replacement parts. The cost of labor and material is above the $50 gap in price to a PRUSA mini which is superior in every way. The print quality IS good (Once you modify the crap out of it) but just don’t bother.

Plus the software is absolutely horrible it barely runs without crashing and has virtually no functionality.

product_meta.title: Cube 3 Printer, Grey
product_meta.description: Color:GreyThe Cube 3D printer brings your creative projects to life, building dual-color objects on a print platform that stays cool throughout the process. Wireless connectivity and a color touch-screen let you transfer a project from your computer or smartphone to your printer with ease. Take the printer out of the box, and with the snap and load smart cartridges, you can be printing in minutes. These cartridges keep your filament fresh and communicate with your Cube so you don't have to. It tells your Cube which material settings to use and how much filament is left, so you never run out mid print. Safe for the classroom-Cube is recommended for children 8+ and meets IEC Home Printer Certification 60953 (TUV).
feature_bullets: Dual extruder prints in 2 colors and multiple materials, including PLA, ABS, and Infinity Rinse-Away support material
Allows printing of designs up to 6"H x 6"W x 6"D
Print your designs wirelessly from your PC or mobile device using the free Cubify app
Fast, easy set up with an integrated color touch screen that guides you through the set up and printing process
Prints in two resolutions: 200 microns for standard resolution, or 70 microns for high resolution
